CatDescriptText: Mrs. Julia Foster, 2268 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "Yes, I do think so. And particularly in business.  They seem to be afraid to do business with other Negroes, especially where there is a little bit of money involved."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Julia Foster standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with pedestrians and Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
